intro: Acrotrema walkeri var. argyroneuron, commonly known as the silver-tipped moss, is a rare and specialized liverwort species. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, delicate foliage. The plant exhibits a unique morphological feature with its silvery, appressed leaves that give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocky surfaces. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
